comment: Very easy course to get an A in. Prof. Meurs responds quickly and isn't a harsh grader. Just submit everything on time, and you'll be fine. There is a group project; communicate, and it's fine.

The course is very easy; there is a group project, but it was manageable (even as I took this over the summer). It was very easy to stay on top of.The prof. sent out reminders every week, and grading things very quickly. There are hard cut-off times, so turn in your work on time, and it'll be okay.

Very easy class. Grades assignments fairly quickly. Other than the group project, everything else can be done with very little effort. It is hard not to get an A with how easy and manageable the exams/quizzes are. If you do take this class online, make sure to communicate with your group early on for the project. I would take him again!

Great guy, but if you don't show up to class, good luck getting the info on the slides. He redacts like half of his lecture slides on D2L. If you see in the syllabus that it's a lecture day, be sure to be in class. Group project was terrible and he didn't help much with it. Gets side-tracked easily and hard to follow at times. Would not take again.

He's fun, but a lot of lectures he seems to spiral off-topic, which can be difficult. There's no peer evaluations for the group project, so if you end up doing all the work for your 30 page group project like I did and come to him about it, he'll say "sorry that's the business world". Nice guy, but I don't feel like I learned much in the class.
Really cares for the student's success just do you part and he will for sure make sure all goes well.

His course was extremely easy, so if you want an easy A take him. If you want to learn about human resources though I would choose another professor. He uses the same material for other courses, felt like I was retaking a class.

THE best professor I have ever had! You can see from his lectures that he genuinely loves teaching and cares about his students(plus his dad jokes don't get old)! 3 exams and one semester project plus a TON of extra credit opportunities, which include 4 special topic days (which I HIGHLY recommend that you attend even if you don't need the credit)

This prof is the best prof I have ever had very understanding and quick responder to emails. Extremely recommend that you take this prof 100% worth it. I would take this class over a 100 times and if I could I would take every class for my major with this prof! Really is amazing!

First time writing a review on a professor, positive or negative. He's hands down the best professor I've had at KSU. He is so caring/passionate about his courses & his students. He goes out of his way to make sure his lectures are interesting & even started a conversation w/ me before class about a sticker on my laptop. Easy A if you attend class.

I absolutely love his class. He is so interactive with his lectures, and does EVERYTHING he can to make sure you fully understand the material. Group project is super easy if you put in the effort. If you want to actually learn  the material, get an easy A+, and have fun then take his class. You won't regret it!!!

Professor Meurs is easily one of the kindest people I've ever met. He cares so much about his students' success, and is incredibly passionate about his subject matter. Lots of extra credit is available if you struggle or fall behind. A large group project that is broken up throughout the semester to make it easier. He grades relatively lightly.
He can be a bit boring however the class is very straightforward and you'll get an A as long as you show up and take notes.

HE IS AMAZING!! So refreshing to listen to and so caring. I looked forward to going to class and learning from him. All semester long was full of his jokes and sense of humor as well as important topics covered. Take him!!! You will not regret taking his course. 3 exams, non-cumulative, all based on his lectures more than the textbook. Take again!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He wants to see you succeed & learn. Take his class if you're sick of asking yourself "what am I paying for?" or "who does this professor think they are" u will not regret it. His honesty is refreshing. He puts so much time, effort, & passion into every lecture. He is funny, inspirational, and dedicated to his students. The best KSU has to offer!

He was my favorite teacher. The class itself is super easy, just show up and take notes and review them and you will pass every test! Do the extra credit papers for bonus points on each exam, and show up to the special topics classes for more bonus. Group project is easy, just don't wait until the last minute! Take him to learn something!

Professor Meurs was very knowledgable about this subject and made sure to talk more about topics he thought would be more useful to his students. His tests are not difficult at all, and the project is very manageable. He's a very friendly professor and often tried to make the content fun with jokes. He also has a great taste in music!
He is a great professor. Tests are straight forwards. Only grades are 3 exams and 1 group project.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the best professors Ive had here at Kennesaw. Professor Meurs truly cares about his students and although he is highly intelligent he is able to make the material relatable and fun. He stemmed away from traditional teaching and made each lecture interesting and engaging. Go to class and follow the powerpoints and you will get an A!

The year consisted of several tests and a massive group project (30+ pages). Get a good group, the project is huge and extremely detailed. I didn't get much out of the actual class. Tests are exactly what you learn in class. Recommended for easy A.

Great professor who genuinely cares about his students and their success. Easy A, if you show up to class and take notes off his powerpoint lectures. Guaranteed A on tests and he gives extra credit frequently. He tries to make his lectures entertaining and wants to make his students laugh.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT
